images.copyright: Blooming wild garlic, Hainich National Park, Germany (© Frank Sommariva/Getty Images)
images.title: Stop and smell the…garlic?
images.caption: Wild garlic in bloom at Hainich National Park, Germany
images.desc: These pristine, white blooms are wild garlic plants, probably not what comes to mind when you think of flowers. You can get a closer look if you visit the Hainich National Park in Thuringia, Germany. This national park was founded in 1997 to protect its ancient beech forest, which is full of lush deciduous trees.
